definition: lit. a horse that has thrown off the reins (idiom); runaway horse/out of control
to shed/to take off/to escape/to get away from
bridle/reins/halter
variant of 韁|缰[jiang1]
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: The speed of a runaway horse counts for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 脱缰之马的速度毫无价值。

sentences.english: Another spike in unemployment could well set it loose.
sentences.chinese: 失业率的再次攀升可能会让保护主义成为脱缰之马。

sentences.english: Zeal without knowledge is a runaway horse .
sentences.chinese: 缺乏知识之热情犹如脱缰之马。
物价飞涨，有如脱缰之马。

sentences.english: This is, first and foremost, a crisis brought on by a runaway financial industry.
sentences.chinese: 这危机首先是归因于如脱缰之马难以控制的金融业。

sentences.english: He was praised for bringing up the runaway horse.
sentences.chinese: 他勒住了脱缰之马受到了表扬。

sentences.english: Z Zeal without knowledge is a runaway horse.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏知识之热心犹如脱缰之马。

sentences.english: The speed of a runaway horse count for nothing.
sentences.chinese: 脱缰之马的速度毫无价值。

sentences.english: Zeal without knowledge is a runaway horse.
sentences.chinese: 缺乏知识之热心犹如脱缰之马。

definition: a wild horse that refuses to be bridled (a metaphor for sth that runs wild)
to throw off the reins/runaway (horse)/fig. out of control
(of waves) to surge forward/to roll on in waves/to gallop
Pentium (microprocessor by Intel)
proceeding at a tremendous pace/getting on like a house on fire
impossible to resist (idiom); an irresistible force
lit. ten thousand stampeding horses (idiom)/fig. with great momentum/going full speed ahead
fine horse/steed
lit. the giant Peng bird spreads its wings and begins to fly/displaying awesome power and momentum at the outset/to have the world at one's feet
(of torrents) rush down/pour down
to soar into the sky
to flow at great speed/to pour/racing current
bridle/reins/halter
variant of 韁|缰[jiang1]
to criss-cross/to run unhindered across the whole country
all things tend in one direction (idiom)
(literary) (swift like a) speeding horse
thousands of horses, all mute (idiom); no-one dares to speak out/an atmosphere of political oppression
